variable.name: Acinar
variable.description: % of this cell component (acinar) in tissue

variable.name: BAC
variable.description: % of this cell component (bronchioloalveolar carcinoma) in tissue

variable.name: BAC_Type
variable.description: Type of BAC (bronchioloalveolar carcinoma), if present

variable.name: Clear_Cell
variable.description: % of this cell component (clear cell) in tissue

variable.name: Colloid
variable.description: % of this cell component (colloid) in tissue

variable.name: Frozen_Acinar
variable.description: Presence or absence of this cell component (acinar) in fixed tissue

variable.name: Frozen_BAC
variable.description: Presence or absence of this cell component (bronchioloalveolar carcinoma) in fixed tissue

variable.name: Frozen_Comment
variable.description: Histopathology, if frozen is discordant

variable.name: Frozen_Concordant
variable.description: Is frozen tissue representative of diagnosis?

variable.name: Frozen_Micropapillary
variable.description: Presence or absence of this cell component (micropapillary) in fixed tissue

variable.name: Frozen_Papillary
variable.description: Presence or absence of this cell component (papillary) in fixed tissue

variable.name: Frozen_Solid
variable.description: Presence or absence of this cell component (solid) in fixed tissue

variable.name: Grade
variable.description: Grade of tumor

variable.name: Max_Size
variable.description: Maximum size of tumor

variable.name: Micropapillary
variable.description: % of this cell component (micropapillary) in tissue

variable.name: M_Stage
variable.description: Metastatic involvement

variable.name: N_Stage
variable.description: Regional lymph node involvement
variable.value: Ipsilateral bronchopulmonary or hilar nodes involved

Ipsilateral mediastinal nodes or ligament involved a) Upper paratracheal and lower paratracheal nodes, b) Pretracheal and retrotracheal nodes, c) Aortic and aortic window nodes, d) Para-aortic nodes, e) Para-esophageal nodes, f) Pulmonary ligament, g) Subcarinal nodesm
Contralateral mediastinal or hilar nodes involved or any scalene or supraclavicular nodes involved

variable.name: Papillary
variable.description: % of this cell component (papillary) in tissue

variable.name: Pathology_DX
variable.description: Histopathology
variable.value: Pleiomorphic Carcinomas of the Lung -- cells in the tumor have all different size and shapes

variable.name: Path_Review
variable.description: Source of pathology review

variable.name: Percent_Tumor
variable.description: % tumor cells in frozen tissue

variable.name: Signet_Ring
variable.description: % of this cell component (signet ring) in tissue

variable.name: Site
variable.description: Anatomic site of tumor

variable.name: Solid
variable.description: % of this cell component (solid) in tissue

variable.name: Stage
variable.description: Stage grouping including T, N, M (Tumor size, Regional lymph node involvement, and Metastasis)
variable.value: T1N0M0 (where T1=<3cm, N0=no lymph nodes, M0=no metastasis)
T2N0M0 (where T2=>3cm (but does not occupy entire lung), N0=no lymph nodes, M0=no metastasis)

variable.name: TSP_Tumor_DNA_ID
variable.description: Unique tumor DNA code number

variable.name: T_Stage
variable.description: Primary tumor staging
variable.value: Diameter of 3 cm or smaller and surrounded by lung or visceral pleura or endobronchial tumor distal to the lobar bronchus

Diameter greater than 3 cm; extension to the visceral pleura, atelectasis, or obstructive pneumopathy involving less than 1 lung; lobar endobronchial tumor; or tumor of a main bronchus more than 2 cm from the carina

Tumor at the apex; total atelectasis of 1 lung; endobronchial tumor of main bronchus within 2 cm of the carina but not invading it; or tumor of any size with direct extension to the adjacent structures such as the chest wall mediastinal pleura diaphragm, pericardium parietal layer, or mediastinal fat of the phrenic nerve

Invasion of the mediastinal organs, including the esophagus, trachea, carina great vessels, and/or heart; obstruction of the superior vena cava; involvement of a vertebral body; recurrent nerve involvement; malignant pleural or pericardial effusion; or satellite pulmonary nodules within the same lobe as the primary tumor
